title: The Living city
creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Twentieth Century Fund and John Barnes
brief_description: Surveys the need for redevelopment of American cities and the forces which have created problems in urban areas; describes obstacles which deter the elimination of blighted areas and tenements and the relief of traffic congestion. Includes scenes of St Louis in 1890, and of present-day housing and building programs in Baltimore, Philadelphia and Pittsburgh.
